segment.source: 4693(S, F) Recovery of data protection master key was attempted.
segment.target: 4693(S, F) Recovery of data protection master key was attempted.

segment.source: (Windows 10)
segment.target: (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes security event 4693(S, F) Recovery of data protection master key was attempted.
segment.target: Describes security event 4693(S, F) Recovery of data protection master key was attempted.

segment.source: 4693(S, F): Recovery of data protection master key was attempted.
segment.target: 4693(S, F): Recovery of data protection master key was attempted.

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016
segment.target: Windows Server 2016

segment.source: Event Description:
segment.target: Event Description:

segment.source: This event generates every time that recovery is attempted for a DPAPI Master Key.
segment.target: This event generates every time that recovery is attempted for a DPAPI Master Key.

segment.source: While unprotecting data, if DPAPI cannot use the Master Key protected by the user's password, it sends the backup Master Key to a domain controller by using a mutually authenticated and privacy protected RPC call.
segment.target: While unprotecting data, if DPAPI cannot use the Master Key protected by the user's password, it sends the backup Master Key to a domain controller by using a mutually authenticated and privacy protected RPC call.

segment.source: The domain controller then decrypts the Master Key with its private key and sends it back to the client by using the same protected RPC call.
segment.target: The domain controller then decrypts the Master Key with its private key and sends it back to the client by using the same protected RPC call.

segment.source: This protected RPC call is used to ensure that no one listening on the network can get the Master Key.
segment.target: This protected RPC call is used to ensure that no one listening on the network can get the Master Key.

segment.source: This event generates on domain controllers, member servers, and workstations.
segment.target: This event generates on domain controllers, member servers, and workstations.

segment.source: Failure event generates when a Master Key restore operation fails for some reason.
segment.target: Failure event generates when a Master Key restore operation fails for some reason.

segment.source: Note For recommendations, see Security Monitoring Recommendations for this event.
segment.target: Note For recommendations, see Security Monitoring Recommendations for this event.

segment.source: Event XML:
segment.target: Event XML:

segment.source: Required Server Roles: None.
segment.target: Required Server Roles: None.

segment.source: Minimum OS Version: Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista.
segment.target: Minimum OS Version: Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista.

segment.source: Event Versions: 0.
segment.target: Event Versions: 0.

segment.source: Field Descriptions:
segment.target: Field Descriptions:

segment.source: Subject:
segment.target: Subject:

segment.source: Security ID Type = SID: SID of account that requested the “recover” operation.
segment.target: Security ID Type = SID: SID of account that requested the “recover” operation.

segment.source: Event Viewer automatically tries to resolve SIDs and show the account name.
segment.target: Event Viewer automatically tries to resolve SIDs and show the account name.

segment.source: If the SID cannot be resolved, you will see the source data in the event.
segment.target: If the SID cannot be resolved, you will see the source data in the event.

segment.source: Note A security identifier (SID) is a unique value of variable length used to identify a trustee (security principal).
segment.target: Note A security identifier (SID) is a unique value of variable length used to identify a trustee (security principal).

segment.source: Each account has a unique SID that is issued by an authority, such as an Active Directory domain controller, and stored in a security database.
segment.target: Each account has a unique SID that is issued by an authority, such as an Active Directory domain controller, and stored in a security database.

segment.source: Each time a user logs on, the system retrieves the SID for that user from the database and places it in the access token for that user.
segment.target: Each time a user logs on, the system retrieves the SID for that user from the database and places it in the access token for that user.

segment.source: The system uses the SID in the access token to identify the user in all subsequent interactions with Windows security.
segment.target: The system uses the SID in the access token to identify the user in all subsequent interactions with Windows security.

segment.source: When a SID has been used as the unique identifier for a user or group, it cannot ever be used again to identify another user or group.
segment.target: When a SID has been used as the unique identifier for a user or group, it cannot ever be used again to identify another user or group.

segment.source: For more information about SIDs, see Security identifiers.
segment.target: For more information about SIDs, see Security identifiers.

segment.source: Account Name Type = UnicodeString: the name of the account that requested the “recover” operation.
segment.target: Account Name Type = UnicodeString: the name of the account that requested the “recover” operation.

segment.source: Account Domain Type = UnicodeString: subject’s domain or computer name.
segment.target: Account Domain Type = UnicodeString: subject’s domain or computer name.

segment.source: Formats vary, and include the following:
segment.target: Formats vary, and include the following:

segment.source: Domain NETBIOS name example: CONTOSO
segment.target: Domain NETBIOS name example: CONTOSO

segment.source: Lowercase full domain name: contoso.local
segment.target: Lowercase full domain name: contoso.local

segment.source: Uppercase full domain name: CONTOSO.LOCAL
segment.target: Uppercase full domain name: CONTOSO.LOCAL

segment.source: For some well-known security principals, such as LOCAL SERVICE or ANONYMOUS LOGON, the value of this field is “NT AUTHORITY”.
segment.target: For some well-known security principals, such as LOCAL SERVICE or ANONYMOUS LOGON, the value of this field is “NT AUTHORITY”.

segment.source: For local user accounts, this field will contain the name of the computer or device that this account belongs to, for example: “Win81”.
segment.target: For local user accounts, this field will contain the name of the computer or device that this account belongs to, for example: “Win81”.

segment.source: Logon ID Type = HexInt64: hexadecimal value that can help you correlate this event with recent events that might contain the same Logon ID, for example, “4624: An account was successfully logged on.”
segment.target: Logon ID Type = HexInt64: hexadecimal value that can help you correlate this event with recent events that might contain the same Logon ID, for example, “4624: An account was successfully logged on.”

segment.source: Key Information:
segment.target: Key Information:

segment.source: Key Identifier Type = UnicodeString: unique identifier of a master key which was recovered.
segment.target: Key Identifier Type = UnicodeString: unique identifier of a master key which was recovered.

segment.source: The Master Key is used, with some additional data, to generate an actual symmetric session key to encryptdecrypt the data using DPAPI.
segment.target: The Master Key is used, with some additional data, to generate an actual symmetric session key to encryptdecrypt the data using DPAPI.

segment.source: All of user's Master Keys are located in user profile - %APPDATA%RoamingMicrosoftWindowsProtect%SID% folder.
segment.target: All of user's Master Keys are located in user profile - %APPDATA%RoamingMicrosoftWindowsProtect%SID% folder.

segment.source: The name of every Master Key file is it’s ID.
segment.target: The name of every Master Key file is it’s ID.

segment.source: Recovery Server Type = UnicodeString: the name (typically – DNS name) of the computer that you contacted to recover your Master Key.
segment.target: Recovery Server Type = UnicodeString: the name (typically – DNS name) of the computer that you contacted to recover your Master Key.

segment.source: For domain joined machines, it’s typically a name of a domain controller.
segment.target: For domain joined machines, it’s typically a name of a domain controller.

segment.source: Note In this event Recovery Server field contains information from Recovery Reason field.
segment.target: Note In this event Recovery Server field contains information from Recovery Reason field.

segment.source: Recovery Key ID Type = UnicodeString: unique identifier of a recovery key.
segment.target: Recovery Key ID Type = UnicodeString: unique identifier of a recovery key.

segment.source: The recovery key is generated when a user chooses to create a Password Reset Disk (PRD) from the user's Control Panel or when first Master Key is generated.
segment.target: The recovery key is generated when a user chooses to create a Password Reset Disk (PRD) from the user's Control Panel or when first Master Key is generated.

segment.source: First, DPAPI generates a RSA public/private key pair, which is the recovery key.
segment.target: First, DPAPI generates a RSA public/private key pair, which is the recovery key.

segment.source: In this field you will see unique Recovery key ID which was used for Master key recovery operation.
segment.target: In this field you will see unique Recovery key ID which was used for Master key recovery operation.

segment.source: This parameter might not be captured in the event, and in that case will be empty.
segment.target: This parameter might not be captured in the event, and in that case will be empty.

segment.source: Recovery Reason Type = HexInt32: hexadecimal code of recovery reason.
segment.target: Recovery Reason Type = HexInt32: hexadecimal code of recovery reason.

segment.source: Note In this event Recovery Reason field contains information from Recovery Server field.
segment.target: Note In this event Recovery Reason field contains information from Recovery Server field.

segment.source: Status Information:
segment.target: Status Information:

segment.source: Status Code Type = HexInt32: hexadecimal unique status code.
segment.target: Status Code Type = HexInt32: hexadecimal unique status code.

segment.source: For Success events this field is typically “0x380000”.
segment.target: For Success events this field is typically “0x380000”.

segment.source: Security Monitoring Recommendations
segment.target: Security Monitoring Recommendations

segment.source: For 4693(S, F): Recovery of data protection master key was attempted.
segment.target: For 4693(S, F): Recovery of data protection master key was attempted.

segment.source: This event is typically an informational event and it is difficult to detect any malicious activity using this event.
segment.target: This event is typically an informational event and it is difficult to detect any malicious activity using this event.

segment.source: It’s mainly used for DPAPI troubleshooting.
segment.target: It’s mainly used for DPAPI troubleshooting.

segment.source: For domain joined computers, Recovery Reason should typically be a domain controller DNS name.
segment.target: For domain joined computers, Recovery Reason should typically be a domain controller DNS name.

segment.source: Important For this event, also see Appendix A: Security monitoring recommendations for many audit events.
segment.target: Important For this event, also see Appendix A: Security monitoring recommendations for many audit events.
